newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent up on expiry buying, NYMEX firm.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent up on expiry buying, NYMEX firm.

text.p: Brent crude futures prices held earlier gains into late trading on Friday, supported by a rise in NYMEX values and expiry related buying.
July, which expires during London trading, was last traded on SIMEX at $17.60 per barrel, up 16 cents from London overnight. Volume was 190 lots.
August Brent was last traded at $17.95, up 24 on 719 lots, as focus of most-active trading switched forward.
Brokers said the expiry of the July contract had sparked some short covering of positions.
However, NYMEX was firmer as buyers targeted a $19.00 per barrel strike price for July options which expire in New York later.
The July contract was last traded on ACCESS at $19.01, up 32 cents from New York.

Traders said open interest positions on NYMEX July options, which expire at the end of New York business on Friday, indicated there would be a move towards $19.00 per barrel or even $19.50 on the futures contract.
